definitions.definition: A search for sunken or buried treasure.
A game in which people have to find hidden objects or places, with the help of clues.
A horizontal component of a structure
Horizon
A Tasmanian shrub or small tree whose main trunk tends to lean over and grow horizontally, Anodopetalum biglandulosum
Perpendicular to the vertical; parallel to the plane of the horizon; level, flat
Relating to horizontal markets
Pertaining to the horizon
definitions.example: 1667: As when the Sun new ris'n / Looks through the Horizontal misty Air — John Milton, Paradise Lost, Book 1, ll. 594-5

definitions.definition: (wine tasting) involving wines of the same vintages but from different wineries
Of an interval: having the two notes sound successively.
A sloping surface, leading down to the shore or to a river, on which ships are built, repaired or stored and from which they are launched.
A sloped side of a river acting as a barrier between the water and level ground to either side.
A fragment or piece broken off from something, especially a broken-off piece of a spear or lance.
The shaft of a spear.
A short staff, a club; a cudgel.
A baton, or military staff of command, now especially the stick carried by a police officer.
A stout stem, as of a tree, with the branches lopped off, to produce rapid growth.
A penis.
To strike with a truncheon.
A soft-bodied invertebrate of the phylum Mollusca, typically with a hard shell of one or more pieces.
A weak-willed person.
(of a person) The quality of speaking or stating the truth; truthfulness.
Something that is true; a truthful statement; a truth.
Agreement with the facts; accordance with the truth; accuracy or precision.
Act of being exact and accurate.
Correctness and carefulness in one's plan of action.
An unruly lock or section of hair that sticks straight out from the skull or lies at an angle at odds with the rest of an individual's hair, like a whorl or vortex.
A computerized interactive system for storing, processing and reproducing verbal messages left through a conventional telephone network.
(by extension) An individual message on such a system.
(nutrition) A sugar, starch, or cellulose that is a food source of energy for an animal or plant.
definitions.example: These microbes are primarily responsible for breaking down cellulose and other carbohydrates into volatile fatty acids (VFAs).

definitions.definition: (by extension, metonym) Any food rich in starch or other carbohydrates.
definitions.example: I'm cutting down on carbohydrates like bread and pasta.

definitions.definition: A feeler organ on the head of an insect, crab, or other animal.
An apparatus to receive or transmit electromagnetic waves and convert respectively to or from an electrical signal.
The faculty of intuitive astuteness.
A fragment of an oligosaccharide
The spar to which a lateen sail is attached, which is then hoisted up the mast.
The most central of the strikers; traditionally the player who makes the kick-off.
A drug that causes an addiction.
Anything that is very habit-forming.
Causing or tending to cause addiction; habit-forming.
definitions.example: These are addictive drugs.

definitions.definition: Enjoyable.
definitions.example: Have you seen that new TV show? It's so addictive.

definitions.definition: Characterized by or susceptible to addiction.
definitions.example: He has an addictive personality.

definitions.definition: A monastery or convent governed by a prior or prioress.
Zayin, Hebrew letter ז.
A swimming stroke swum lying on one's back, while rotating both arms through the water as to propel the swimmer backwards.
(bellringing) The pull on the tail of the rope that swings the bell through a full circle (compare handstroke)
To swim the backstroke.
The state of being free from the effects of gravity.
An experience or instance of being weightless.
A hard and brittle, but strong, alloy of iron, carbon, and silicon, formed by casting in a mould.
definitions.example: Cast iron is popular for cookware where an even heating temperature is important.

definitions.definition: Made of cast iron.
definitions.example: I use a cast-iron skillet for frying pancakes.

definitions.definition: Durable; tough; resiliant.
definitions.example: Ernest has a cast-iron constitution and never gets sick.

definitions.definition: Inflexible or without exception.
definitions.example: The school's cast-iron policy on admissions fees left no leeway for needy students.

definitions.definition: A type of game controller held in the hand, where the digits (especially thumbs) are used to provide input
To exhibit a conspicuous (sometimes malevolent) pleasure or sense of self-satisfaction, often at an adversary's misfortune.
To triumph, crow, relish, glory, revel.
The act of one who gloats.
A very small pie, the crust of which is made entirely of flaky pastry and baked in its own pie tin, usually for one person.
To take somebody's fingerprints.
definitions.example: The jail staff fingerprints its inmates routinely

definitions.definition: To identify something uniquely by a combination of measurements.
An act of recording somebody's fingerprints.
An act or instance of adding.
An additional enemy that joins a fight after the primary target.
definitions.example: When the player has fought the boss for one minute, two adds will arrive from the back and must be dealt with.

definitions.definition: To join or unite (e.g. one thing to another, or as several particulars) so as to increase the number, augment the quantity or enlarge the magnitude, or so as to form into one aggregate.
To sum up; to put together mentally.
definitions.example: to add numbers

definitions.definition: To combine elements of (something) into one quantity.
definitions.example: to add a column of numbers

definitions.definition: To give by way of increased possession (to someone); to bestow (on).
To append (e,g, a statement); to say further information.
To make an addition; to augment; to increase.
definitions.example: It adds to our anxiety.

definitions.definition: To perform the arithmetical operation of addition.
definitions.example: He adds rapidly.

definitions.definition: To summon minions or reinforcements.
definitions.example: Typically, a hostile mob will add whenever it's within the aggro radius of a player.

definitions.definition: Somewhat less than is needed in amplitude or extent.
Sparing; niggardly; parsimonious; stingy.
The opening price for an item at an auction.
The final odds on a horse when the race starts; also used to designate a system of fixed-odds betting using such prices. Abbreviation: SP.
Any of a spectrum of birth defects that result from excessive alcohol consumption by the mother during pregnancy
To pass a more slowly moving object or entity.
definitions.example: The car was so slow we were overtaken by a bus.

definitions.definition: To become greater than something else
To occur unexpectedly; take by surprise; surprise and overcome; carry away
definitions.example: Our plans were overtaken by events.

definitions.definition: A tree, Anacardium occidentale, native to northeastern Brazil, now widely grown in tropical climates for its cashew nuts and cashew apples.
A cashew nut.
The sensation of a sour taste.
A drink made with whiskey, lemon or lime juice and sugar.
(by extension) Any cocktail containing lemon or lime juice.
A sour or acid substance; whatever produces a painful effect.
The acidic solution used in souring fabric.
To make sour.
definitions.example: Too much lemon juice will sour the recipe.

definitions.definition: To become sour.
To spoil or mar; to make disenchanted.
To become disenchanted.
definitions.example: We broke up after our relationship soured.

definitions.definition: To make (soil) cold and unproductive.
To macerate (lime) and render it fit for plaster or mortar.
To process (fabric) after bleaching, using hydrochloric acid or sulphuric acid to wash out the lime.
Having an acidic, sharp or tangy taste.
definitions.example: Lemons have a sour taste.

definitions.definition: Made rancid by fermentation, etc.
definitions.example: Don't drink that milk; it's turned sour.

definitions.definition: Tasting or smelling rancid.
definitions.example: His sour breath makes it unpleasing to talk to him.

definitions.definition: (of a person's character) Peevish or bad-tempered.
definitions.example: He gave me a sour look.

definitions.definition: (of soil) Excessively acidic and thus infertile.
definitions.example: a sour marsh

definitions.definition: (of petroleum) Containing excess sulfur.
definitions.example: sour gas smells like rotten eggs

definitions.definition: Unfortunate or unfavorable.
Off-pitch, out of tune.
The owner of property that is leased.
A species of mallow, Althaea officinalis, that grows in marshy terrain.

A type of confectionery, originally (since Ancient Egyptian times) made from this plant, but now generally made of sugar or corn syrup, gelatin that has been pre-softened in water, gum arabic, flavorings, and sometimes beaten egg whites, all whipped to a spongy consistency.
Someone who is soft and benign.
definitions.example: He acts like a total badass, but he's really just a marshmallow once you get to know him.

definitions.definition: To soften (literally or figuratively)
Someone unfamiliar with the sea or seamanship, especially a novice seaman.
A mate, companion, or associate.
A companion in battle; fellow soldier.
A fellow socialist, communist or other similarly politically aligned person.
definitions.example: Hello, comrade. Are you going to the Communist Party meeting tonight?

definitions.definition: A gender-neutral title, functionally similar to "Mr.", "Mrs.", "Miss", "Ms." etc, in a communist or socialist state.
definitions.example: Comrade Lenin inspired our people to undertake great works.

definitions.definition: To associate with in a friendly way.
The sensationalist tabloid newspapers in general.
A tin whistle.
(except Scotland) (High Sheriff) An official of a shire or county office, responsible for carrying out court orders, law enforcement and other duties.
A judge in the sheriff court, the court of a county or sheriffdom.
A government official, usually responsible for law enforcement in his county and for administration of the county jail, sometimes an officer of the court, usually elected.
To carry out the duties of a sheriff
A small drum.
To make (a sound) with a tabor.
To strike lightly and frequently.
A military train of men and wagons; an encampment of such resources.
A flat pastry pressed with a grid pattern.
definitions.example: The brunch was waffles with strawberries and whipped cream.

definitions.definition: A potato waffle, a savoury flat potato cake with the same kind of grid pattern.
To smash.
Speech or writing that is vague, pretentious or evasive.
definitions.example: This interesting point seems to get lost a little within a lot of self-important waffle.

definitions.definition: (of birds) To move in a side-to-side motion and descend (lose altitude) before landing. Cf wiffle, whiffle.
definitions.example: The geese waffled as they approached the water.

definitions.definition: To speak or write vaguely and evasively.
To speak or write at length without any clear point or aim.
To vacillate.
To rotate (one's hand) back and forth in a gesture of vacillation or ambivalence.
Distress of mind caused by a failure of aims or plans, want of appreciation, mistakes etc; vexation or mortification.
A type of leather or skin with a rough surface.
To bother or vex; to mortify.
To be vexed or annoyed.
Feeling chagrin; annoyed; vexed, fretful.
The Abrahamic doctrine that each individual human soul is created by God, as opposed to traducianism.

Any creationary belief, especially a belief that the origin of things is due to an event or process of creation brought about by the deliberate act of any divine agency, such as a Creator God (creator god).
The belief that a deity created the world, especially as described in a particular religious text, such as the Quran or the Book of Genesis.
definitions.example: 2008, Thomas Dixon, Science and Religion: A Very Short Introduction, link

definitions.definition: A method of power transmission by means of belts that connect pulleys on shafts
An area to which access is restricted because it is contaminated with radiation or a chemical or biological biohazard.
An area where fighting or hostilities are likely to erupt.
An apparatus for growing crystals at very hot temperatures.
A horizontal metal grill through which water, ash, or small objects can fall, while larger objects cannot
definitions.example: The grate stopped the sheep from escaping from their field.

definitions.definition: A frame or bed, or kind of basket, of iron bars, for holding fuel while burning
To furnish with grates; to protect with a grating or crossbars
definitions.example: to grate a window

definitions.definition: To shred (things, usually foodstuffs), by rubbing across a grater
definitions.example: I need to grate the cheese before the potato is cooked.

definitions.definition: To make an unpleasant rasping sound, often as the result of rubbing against something
definitions.example: Listening to his teeth grate all day long drives me mad.

definitions.definition: (by extension) to get on one's nerves; to irritate, annoy
definitions.example: She’s nice enough, but she can begin to grate if there is no-one else to talk to.

definitions.definition: (by extension) to annoy
Serving to gratify; agreeable.
Relatively large in scale, size, extent, number (i.e. having many parts or members) or duration (i.e. relatively long); very big.
definitions.example: A great storm is approaching our shores.

definitions.definition: Of larger size or more importance than others of its kind.
definitions.example: the great auk

definitions.definition: (qualifying nouns of family relationship) Involving more generations than the qualified word implies — as many extra generations as repetitions of the word great (from 1510s). [see Derived terms]
definitions.example: great-grandfather, great-great-grandfather, great-great-great-grandfather

definitions.definition: (followed by 'with') Pregnant; large with young; full of.
definitions.example: great with child

definitions.definition: (except with 'friend' and similar words such as 'mate','buddy') Intimate; familiar.
Extreme or more than usual.
definitions.example: great worry

definitions.definition: Of significant importance or consequence; important.
definitions.example: a great decision

definitions.definition: (applied to actions, thoughts and feelings) Arising from or possessing idealism; admirable; superior; commanding; heroic; illustrious; eminent.
definitions.example: a great deed

definitions.definition: Impressive or striking.
definitions.example: a great show of wealth

definitions.definition: Much in use; favoured.
definitions.example: Poetry was a great convention of the Romantic era.

definitions.definition: (applied to persons) Endowed with extraordinary powers; of exceptional talents or achievements; uncommonly gifted; able to accomplish vast results; remarkable; strong; powerful; mighty; noble.
definitions.example: a great hero, scholar, genius, philosopher, writer etc.

definitions.definition: Title referring to an important leader.
definitions.example: Alexander the Great

definitions.definition: Doing or exemplifying (a characteristic or pursuit) on a large scale; active or enthusiastic.
definitions.example: He's not a great one for reading.

definitions.definition: (often followed by 'at') Skilful or adroit.
definitions.example: You are great at singing.

definitions.definition: Very good; excellent; wonderful; fantastic (from 1848).
definitions.example: Dinner was great.

definitions.definition: Intensifying a word or expression, used in mild oaths.
definitions.example: Great Scott!

definitions.definition: The young of certain animals, especially a group of young birds or fowl hatched at one time by the same mother.
The young of any egg-laying creature, especially if produced at the same time.
The eggs and larvae of social insects such as bees, ants and some wasps, especially when gathered together in special brood chambers or combs within the colony.
The children in one family; offspring.
That which is bred or produced; breed; species.
Parentage.
Heavy waste in tin and copper ores.
To keep an egg warm to make it hatch.
definitions.example: In some species of birds, both the mother and father brood the eggs.

definitions.definition: To protect (something that is gradually maturing); to foster.
definitions.example: Under the rock was a midshipman fish, brooding a mass of eggs.

definitions.definition: (typically with about or over) To dwell upon moodily and at length, mainly alone.
definitions.example: He sat brooding about the upcoming battle, fearing the outcome.

definitions.definition: To be bred.
Kept or reared for breeding, said of animals.
definitions.example: a brood mare

definitions.definition: The middle section of the human torso, from below the chest to above the waist
In the International System of Units, the derived unit of power; the power of a system in which one joule of energy is transferred per second. Symbol: W
Somebody with whom one works.
definitions.example: He heard from a coworker that the company planned to merge those departments.

definitions.definition: A learning disability.
Any of a series of medically recognized conditions (as opposed to diseases) that inhibit a person's ability to function in the world.
A male goat.
A safe room.
A person employed to gloss over a poor public image (or present it in a better light) in business and politics, especially after unfavourable results have been achieved. A lobbyist; PR person.
definitions.example: Many believed that the reduction in public spending was a disaster but the spin doctors presented it as a triumph for lower taxation.

definitions.definition: To generate spin (favourable interpretation or bias).
A variety of soft, mild French cheese made from cow's milk.
Any of various lycaenid butterflies of the genus Pithecops.
The natural pattern of ridges on the tips of human fingers, unique to each individual.
The patterns left on surfaces where uncovered fingertips have touched, especially as used to identify the person who touched the surface.
Unique identification for public key in asymmetric cryptosystem.
A unique combination of features that serves as an identification of something.
A trace that gives evidence of someone's involvement.
To take somebody's fingerprints.
definitions.example: The jail staff fingerprints its inmates routinely

definitions.definition: To identify something uniquely by a combination of measurements.
An effect; especially, one that is experienced only after a delay, or only in the long term.
An article of protective clothing that is designed to keep the wearer's head floating above the surface of the water.
A slow-paced Cuban partner dance in 4:4 time.
To dance the rumba
A person, in a church, cinema etc., who escorts people to their seats.
A male escort at a wedding.
A doorkeeper in a courtroom.
An assistant to a head teacher or schoolteacher; an assistant teacher.
Any schoolteacher.
To guide people to their seats.
To accompany or escort (someone).
To precede; to act as a forerunner or herald.
To lead or guide somewhere
Uncountable noun
A department of a hospital where seriously ill or injured patients, often with life-threatening conditions that require urgent or immediate treatment, are brought in, usually by ambulance.
A trick or device used to attain some end.
definitions.example: The box had a gimmick to make the coin appear to vanish.

definitions.definition: A clever ploy or strategy.
definitions.example: The contest was a gimmick to get people to sign up for their mailing list.

definitions.definition: A gimmick capacitor.
A night out with one's friends.
To rig or set up with a trick or device.
definitions.example: The magician's box was gimmicked with a wire that made it appear to open on its own.

definitions.definition: An inn that provides overnight accommodation for travellers (and, originally, their horses).
The art and skill of guest management at a commercial facility such as a hotel, inn, motel, bed and breakfast, or hostel.
definitions.example: a degree in hostelry and tourism

definitions.definition: Excessively fond.

One of two folds of lymphatic tissue covered by ciliated epithelium. They are found in the roof and posterior wall of the nasopharynx at the back of the throat behind the uvula. They may obstruct normal breathing and make speech difficult when swollen, a condition often called adenitis.
To undo the process of listing; to remove something from a list.
Not included in a list.

A violent windstorm of limited extent, as the tornado, characterized by an inward spiral motion of the air with an upward current in the center; a vortex of air. It usually has a rapid progressive motion.
A person or body of objects or events sweeping violently onward.
definitions.example: Once he got that new scooter he turned into a whirlwind and damaged all the flowers.

definitions.definition: Rapid and minimal: a whirlwind tour, a whirlwind romance.
The branch of biology dealing with the relationships of organisms with their environment and with each other.
A triangle having a right angle as one of its interior angles.
A traffic control signal, traditionally consisting of three lights, colored green, yellow/amber and red, meaning proceed, prepare to stop and stop, respectively.
A light on the rear of a vehicle that is activated when braking; a brake light.
Brassica oleracea var. botrytis, an annual variety of cabbage, of which the cluster of young flower stalks and buds is eaten as a vegetable.
The edible head or curd of a cauliflower plant.
The swelling of a cauliflower ear.
The quality or degree of being bad.
Someone who frequently loiters in a shopping mall.
A breed of dog originating in Europe as hunting dogs, and having heavy, curly coat in a solid color; their shoulder height indicates their classification as standard, medium, miniature, or toy.
A person servile towards someone whom he or she considers his or her superior.
A cylindrical or rectangular container usually of lightweight metal, plastic, or laminated pasteboard used for holding a dry product (as tea, crackers, flour, matches).
Any of various cylindrical metal receptacles usually with a removable close-fitting top.

A special short range antipersonnel projectile consisting of a casing of light metal, loaded with preformed submissiles such as flechettes or steel balls. The casing is designed to open just beyond the muzzle of the weapon, dispersing the submissiles.
A component of canister type protective mask containing a mechanical filter and chemical filling to filter, neutralize and/or absorb toxic chemical, biological and radiological agents.
A projectile component containing colored or screening smoke or riot control agent composition.
To pack into a canister.
Mud or fine earth deposited from running or standing water.
(by extension) Material with similar physical characteristics, whatever its origins or transport.
A particle from 3.9 to 62.5 microns in diameter, following the Wentworth scale.
To clog or fill with silt.
To become clogged with silt.
To flow through crevices; to percolate.
A small diner or restaurant that serves lunch.
A divided highway where intersections and direct access to adjacent properties have been eliminated.
(parts of the US) A road built to freeway standards.
A road built for high speed traffic, but not up to motorway standards or designated a motorway.
A large medal, usually decorative.
A cut of meat resembling a medallion.
A usually round or oval frame (often made of stucco) containing a decoration.
A circular certificate used in some places to register a vehicle, especially a taxicab.
A genre of riddles where the clues to the answer are descriptions or puns on its syllables, with a final clue to the whole.
A single round of the game charades, an acted form of the earlier riddles.
A play resembling the game charades, particularly due to poor acting.
A deception or pretense, originally an absurdly obvious one but now in general use.
definitions.example: This whole charade is absurd.

definitions.definition: To act out a charade (of); to gesture; to pretend.
Filled with, or showing, spite; having a desire to annoy or harm.
